  6310        accept-process-output).  */
  6311     internal_condition_case_1 (read_process_output_call,
  6312                                list3 (outstream, make_lisp_proc (p), text),
  6313                                !NILP (Vdebug_on_error) ? Qnil : Qerror,
  6314                                read_process_output_error_handler);
  6315 
  6316   /* If we saved the match data nonrecursively, restore it now.  */
  6317   restore_search_regs ();
  6318   running_asynch_code = outer_running_asynch_code;
  6319 
  6320   /* Restore waiting_for_user_input_p as it was
  6321      when we were called, in case the filter clobbered it.  */
  6322   waiting_for_user_input_p = waiting;
  6323 }
  6324 
  6325 DEFUN ("internal-default-process-filter", Finternal_default_process_filter,
  6326        Sinternal_default_process_filter, 2, 2, 0,
  6327        doc: /* Function used as default process filter.
  6328 This inserts the process's output into its buffer, if there is one.
  6329 Otherwise it discards the output.  */)
  6330   (Lisp_Object proc, Lisp_Object text)
  6331 {
  6332   struct Lisp_Process *p;
  6333   ptrdiff_t opoint;
  6334 
  6335   CHECK_PROCESS (proc);
  6336   p = XPROCESS (proc);
  6337   CHECK_STRING (text);
  6338 
  6339   if (!NILP (p->buffer) && BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (p->buffer)))
  6340     {
  6341       Lisp_Object old_read_only;
  6342       ptrdiff_t old_begv, old_zv;
  6343       ptrdiff_t before, before_byte;
  6344       ptrdiff_t opoint_byte;
  6345       struct buffer *b;
  6346 
  6347       Fset_buffer (p->buffer);
  6348       opoint = PT;
  6349       opoint_byte = PT_BYTE;
  6350       old_read_only = BVAR (current_buffer, read_only);
  6351       old_begv = BEGV;
  6352       old_zv = ZV;
  6353 
  6354       bset_read_only (current_buffer, Qnil);
  6355 
  6356       /* Insert new output into buffer at the current end-of-output
  6357          marker, thus preserving logical ordering of input and output.  */
  6358       if (XMARKER (p->mark)->buffer)
  6359         set_point_from_marker (p->mark);
  6360       else
  6361         SET_PT_BOTH (ZV, ZV_BYTE);
  6362       before = PT;
  6363       before_byte = PT_BYTE;
  6364 
  6365       /* If the output marker is outside of the visible region, save
  6366          the restriction and widen.  */
  6367       if (! (BEGV <= PT && PT <= ZV))
  6368         Fwiden ();
  6369 
  6370       /* Adjust the multibyteness of TEXT to that of the buffer.  */
  6371       if (NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters))
  6372           != ! STRING_MULTIBYTE (text))
  6373         text = (STRING_MULTIBYTE (text)
  6374                 ? Fstring_as_unibyte (text)
  6375                 : Fstring_to_multibyte (text));
  6376       /* Insert before markers in case we are inserting where
  6377          the buffer's mark is, and the user's next command is Meta-y.  */
  6378       insert_from_string_before_markers (text, 0, 0,
  6379                                          SCHARS (text), SBYTES (text), 0);
  6380 
  6381       /* Make sure the process marker's position is valid when the
  6382          process buffer is changed in the signal_after_change above.
  6383          W3 is known to do that.  */
  6384       if (BUFFERP (p->buffer)
  6385           && (b = XBUFFER (p->buffer), b != current_buffer))
  6386         set_marker_both (p->mark, p->buffer, BUF_PT (b), BUF_PT_BYTE (b));
  6387       else
  6388         set_marker_both (p->mark, p->buffer, PT, PT_BYTE);
  6389 
  6390       update_mode_lines = 23;
  6391 
  6392       /* Make sure opoint and the old restrictions
  6393          float ahead of any new text just as point would.  */
  6394       if (opoint >= before)
  6395         {
  6396           opoint += PT - before;
  6397           opoint_byte += PT_BYTE - before_byte;
  6398         }
  6399       if (old_begv > before)
  6400         old_begv += PT - before;
  6401       if (old_zv >= before)
  6402         old_zv += PT - before;
  6403 
  6404       /* If the restriction isn't what it should be, set it.  */
  6405       if (old_begv != BEGV || old_zv != ZV)
  6406         Fnarrow_to_region (make_fixnum (old_begv), make_fixnum (old_zv));
  6407 
  6408       bset_read_only (current_buffer, old_read_only);
  6409       SET_PT_BOTH (opoint, opoint_byte);
  6410     }
  6411   return Qnil;
  6412 }
  6413 
  6414 /* Sending data to subprocess.  */
  6415 
  6416 /* In send_process, when a write fails temporarily,
  6417    wait_reading_process_output is called.  It may execute user code,
  6418    e.g. timers, that attempts to write new data to the same process.
  6419    We must ensure that data is sent in the right order, and not
  6420    interspersed half-completed with other writes (Bug#10815).  This is
  6421    handled by the write_queue element of struct process.  It is a list
  6422    with each entry having the form
  6423 
  6424    (string . (offset . length))
  6425 
  6426    where STRING is a lisp string, OFFSET is the offset into the
  6427    string's byte sequence from which we should begin to send, and
  6428    LENGTH is the number of bytes left to send.  */
  6429 
  6430 /* Create a new entry in write_queue.
  6431    INPUT_OBJ should be a buffer, string Qt, or Qnil.
  6432    BUF is a pointer to the string sequence of the input_obj or a C
  6433    string in case of Qt or Qnil.  */
  6434 
  6435 static void
  6436 write_queue_push (struct Lisp_Process *p, Lisp_Object input_obj,
  6437                   const char *buf, ptrdiff_t len, bool front)
  6438 {
  6439   ptrdiff_t offset;
  6440   Lisp_Object entry, obj;
  6441 
  6442   if (STRINGP (input_obj))
  6443     {
  6444       offset = buf - SSDATA (input_obj);
  6445       obj = input_obj;
  6446     }
  6447   else
  6448     {
  6449       offset = 0;
  6450       obj = make_unibyte_string (buf, len);
  6451     }
  6452 
  6453   entry = Fcons (obj, Fcons (make_fixnum (offset), make_fixnum (len)));
  6454 
  6455   if (front)
  6456     pset_write_queue (p, Fcons (entry, p->write_queue));
  6457   else
  6458     pset_write_queue (p, nconc2 (p->write_queue, list1 (entry)));
  6459 }
  6460 
  6461 /* Remove the first element in the write_queue of process P, put its
  6462    contents in OBJ, BUF and LEN, and return true.  If the
  6463    write_queue is empty, return false.  */
  6464 
  6465 static bool
  6466 write_queue_pop (struct Lisp_Process *p, Lisp_Object *obj,
  6467                  const char **buf, ptrdiff_t *len)
  6468 {
  6469   Lisp_Object entry, offset_length;
  6470   ptrdiff_t offset;
  6471 
  6472   if (NILP (p->write_queue))
  6473     return 0;
  6474 
  6475   entry = XCAR (p->write_queue);
  6476   pset_write_queue (p, XCDR (p->write_queue));
  6477 
  6478   *obj = XCAR (entry);
  6479   offset_length = XCDR (entry);
  6480 
  6481   *len = XFIXNUM (XCDR (offset_length));
  6482   offset = XFIXNUM (XCAR (offset_length));
  6483   *buf = SSDATA (*obj) + offset;
  6484 
  6485   return 1;
  6486 }
  6487 
  6488 /* Send some data to process PROC.
  6489    BUF is the beginning of the data; LEN is the number of characters.
  6490    OBJECT is the Lisp object that the data comes from.  If OBJECT is
  6491    nil or t, it means that the data comes from C string.
  6492 
  6493    If OBJECT is not nil, the data is encoded by PROC's coding-system
  6494    for encoding before it is sent.
  6495 
  6496    This function can evaluate Lisp code and can garbage collect.  */
  6497 
  6498 static void
  6499 send_process (Lisp_Object proc, const char *buf, ptrdiff_t len,
  6500               Lisp_Object object)
  6501 {
  6502   struct Lisp_Process *p = XPROCESS (proc);
  6503   ssize_t rv;
  6504   struct coding_system *coding;
  6505 
  6506   if (NETCONN_P (proc))
  6507     {
  6508       wait_while_connecting (proc);
  6509       wait_for_tls_negotiation (proc);
  6510     }
  6511 
  6512   if (p->raw_status_new)
  6513     update_status (p);
  6514   if (! EQ (p->status, Qrun))
  6515     error ("Process %s not running: %s", SDATA (p->name), SDATA (status_message (p)));
  6516   if (p->outfd < 0)
  6517     error ("Output file descriptor of %s is closed", SDATA (p->name));
  6518 
  6519   eassert (p->outfd < FD_SETSIZE);
  6520   coding = proc_encode_coding_system[p->outfd];
  6521   Vlast_coding_system_used = CODING_ID_NAME (coding->id);
  6522 
  6523   if ((STRINGP (object) && STRING_MULTIBYTE (object))
  6524       || (BUFFERP (object)
  6525           && !NILP (BVAR (XBUFFER (object), enable_multibyte_characters)))
  6526       || EQ (object, Qt))
  6527     {
  6528       pset_encode_coding_system
  6529         (p, complement_process_encoding_system (p->encode_coding_system));
  6530       if (!EQ (Vlast_coding_system_used, p->encode_coding_system))
  6531         {
  6532           /* The coding system for encoding was changed to raw-text
  6533              because we sent a unibyte text previously.  Now we are
  6534              sending a multibyte text, thus we must encode it by the
  6535              original coding system specified for the current process.
  6536 
  6537              Another reason we come here is that the coding system
  6538              was just complemented and a new one was returned by
  6539              complement_process_encoding_system.  */
  6540           setup_coding_system (p->encode_coding_system, coding);
  6541           Vlast_coding_system_used = p->encode_coding_system;
  6542         }
  6543       coding->src_multibyte = 1;
  6544     }
  6545   else
  6546     {
  6547       coding->src_multibyte = 0;
  6548       /* For sending a unibyte text, character code conversion should
  6549          not take place but EOL conversion should.  So, setup raw-text
  6550          or one of the subsidiary if we have not yet done it.  */
  6551       if (CODING_REQUIRE_ENCODING (coding))
  6552         {
  6553           if (CODING_REQUIRE_FLUSHING (coding))
  6554             {
  6555               /* But, before changing the coding, we must flush out data.  */
  6556               coding->mode |= CODING_MODE_LAST_BLOCK;
  6557               send_process (proc, "", 0, Qt);
  6558               coding->mode &= CODING_MODE_LAST_BLOCK;
  6559             }
  6560           setup_coding_system (raw_text_coding_system
  6561                                (Vlast_coding_system_used),
  6562                                coding);
  6563           coding->src_multibyte = 0;
  6564         }
  6565     }
  6566   coding->dst_multibyte = 0;
  6567 
  6568   if (CODING_REQUIRE_ENCODING (coding))
  6569     {
  6570       coding->dst_object = Qt;
  6571       if (BUFFERP (object))
  6572         {
  6573           ptrdiff_t from_byte, from, to;
  6574           ptrdiff_t save_pt, save_pt_byte;
  6575           struct buffer *cur = current_buffer;
  6576 
  6577           set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (object));
  6578           save_pt = PT, save_pt_byte = PT_BYTE;
  6579 
  6580           from_byte = PTR_BYTE_POS ((unsigned char *) buf);
  6581           from = BYTE_TO_CHAR (from_byte);
  6582           to = BYTE_TO_CHAR (from_byte + len);
  6583           TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (from, from_byte);
  6584           encode_coding_object (coding, object, from, from_byte,
  6585                                 to, from_byte + len, Qt);
  6586           TEMP_SET_PT_BOTH (save_pt, save_pt_byte);
  6587           set_buffer_internal (cur);
  6588         }
  6589       else if (STRINGP (object))
  6590         {
  6591           encode_coding_object (coding, object, 0, 0, SCHARS (object),
  6592                                 SBYTES (object), Qt);
  6593         }
  6594       else
  6595         {
  6596           coding->dst_object = make_unibyte_string (buf, len);
  6597           coding->produced = len;
  6598         }
  6599 
  6600       len = coding->produced;
  6601       object = coding->dst_object;
  6602       buf = SSDATA (object);
  6603     }
  6604 
  6605   /* If there is already data in the write_queue, put the new data
  6606      in the back of queue.  Otherwise, ignore it.  */
  6607   if (!NILP (p->write_queue))
  6608     write_queue_push (p, object, buf, len, 0);
  6609 
  6610   do   /* while !NILP (p->write_queue) */
  6611     {
  6612       ptrdiff_t cur_len = -1;
  6613       const char *cur_buf;
  6614       Lisp_Object cur_object;
  6615 
  6616       /* If write_queue is empty, ignore it.  */
  6617       if (!write_queue_pop (p, &cur_object, &cur_buf, &cur_len))
  6618         {
  6619           cur_len = len;
  6620           cur_buf = buf;
  6621           cur_object = object;
  6622         }
  6623 
  6624       while (cur_len > 0)
  6625         {
  6626           /* Send this batch, using one or more write calls.  */
  6627           ptrdiff_t written = 0;
  6628           int outfd = p->outfd;
  6629           if (outfd < 0)
  6630             error ("Output file descriptor of %s is closed",
  6631                    SDATA (p->name));
  6632           eassert (0 <= outfd && outfd < FD_SETSIZE);
  6633 #ifdef DATAGRAM_SOCKETS
  6634           if (DATAGRAM_CHAN_P (outfd))
  6635             {
  6636               while (true)
  6637                 {
  6638                   rv = sendto (outfd, cur_buf, cur_len, 0,
  6639                                datagram_address[outfd].sa,
  6640                                datagram_address[outfd].len);
  6641                   if (! (rv < 0 && errno == EINTR))
  6642                     break;
  6643                   if (pending_signals)
  6644                     process_pending_signals ();
  6645                 }
  6646 
  6647               if (rv >= 0)
  6648                 written = rv;
  6649               else if (errno == EMSGSIZE)
  6650                 report_file_error ("Sending datagram", proc);
  6651             }
  6652           else
  6653 #endif
  6654             {
  6655 #ifdef HAVE_GNUTLS
  6656               if (p->gnutls_p && p->gnutls_state)
  6657                 written = emacs_gnutls_write (p, cur_buf, cur_len);
  6658               else
  6659 #endif
  6660                 written = emacs_write_sig (outfd, cur_buf, cur_len);
  6661               rv = (written ? 0 : -1);
  6662               if (p->read_output_delay > 0
  6663                   && p->adaptive_read_buffering == 1)
  6664                 {
  6665                   p->read_output_delay = 0;
  6666                   process_output_delay_count--;
  6667                   p->read_output_skip = 0;
  6668                 }
  6669             }
  6670 
  6671           if (rv < 0)
  6672             {
  6673               if (would_block (errno))
  6674                 /* Buffer is full.  Wait, accepting input;
  6675                    that may allow the program
  6676                    to finish doing output and read more.  */
  6677                 {
  6678 #ifdef BROKEN_PTY_READ_AFTER_EAGAIN
  6679                   /* A gross hack to work around a bug in FreeBSD.
  6680                      In the following sequence, read(2) returns
  6681                      bogus data:
  6682 
  6683                      write(2)    1022 bytes
  6684                      write(2)   954 bytes, get EAGAIN
  6685                      read(2)   1024 bytes in process_read_output
  6686                      read(2)     11 bytes in process_read_output
  6687 
  6688                      That is, read(2) returns more bytes than have
  6689                      ever been written successfully.  The 1033 bytes
  6690                      read are the 1022 bytes written successfully
  6691                      after processing (for example with CRs added if
  6692                      the terminal is set up that way which it is
  6693                      here).  The same bytes will be seen again in a
  6694                      later read(2), without the CRs.  */
  6695 
  6696                   if (errno == EAGAIN)
  6697                     {
  6698                       int flags = FWRITE;
  6699                       ioctl (p->outfd, TIOCFLUSH, &flags);
  6700                     }
  6701 #endif /* BROKEN_PTY_READ_AFTER_EAGAIN */
  6702 
  6703                   /* Put what we should have written in write_queue.  */
  6704                   write_queue_push (p, cur_object, cur_buf, cur_len, 1);
  6705                   wait_reading_process_output (0, 20 * 1000 * 1000,
  6706                                                0, 0, Qnil, NULL, 0);
  6707                   /* Reread queue, to see what is left.  */
  6708                   break;
  6709                 }
  6710               else if (errno == EPIPE)
  6711                 {
  6712                   p->raw_status_new = 0;
  6713                   pset_status (p, list2 (Qexit, make_fixnum (256)));
  6714                   p->tick = ++process_tick;
  6715                   deactivate_process (proc);
  6716                   error ("process %s no longer connected to pipe; closed it",
  6717                          SDATA (p->name));
  6718                 }
  6719               else
  6720                 /* This is a real error.  */
  6721                 report_file_error ("Writing to process", proc);
  6722             }
  6723           cur_buf += written;
  6724           cur_len -= written;
  6725         }
  6726     }
  6727   while (!NILP (p->write_queue));
  6728 }
  6729 
  6730 DEFUN ("process-send-region", Fprocess_send_region, Sprocess_send_region,
  6731        3, 3, 0,
  6732        doc: /* Send current contents of region as input to PROCESS.
  6733 PROCESS may be a process, a buffer, the name of a process or buffer, or
  6734 nil, indicating the current buffer's process.
  6735 Called from program, takes three arguments, PROCESS, START and END.
  6736 If the region is larger than the input buffer of the process (the
  6737 length of which depends on the process connection type and the
  6738 operating system), it is sent in several bunches.  This may happen
  6739 even for shorter regions.  Output from processes can arrive in between
  6740 bunches.
  6741 
  6742 If PROCESS is a non-blocking network process that hasn't been fully
  6743 set up yet, this function will block until socket setup has completed.  */)
  6744   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object start, Lisp_Object end)
  6745 {
  6746   Lisp_Object proc = get_process (process);
  6747   ptrdiff_t start_byte, end_byte;
  6748 
  6749   validate_region (&start, &end);
  6750 
  6751   start_byte = CHAR_TO_BYTE (XFIXNUM (start));
  6752   end_byte = CHAR_TO_BYTE (XFIXNUM (end));
  6753 
  6754   if (XFIXNUM (start) < GPT && XFIXNUM (end) > GPT)
  6755     move_gap_both (XFIXNUM (start), start_byte);
  6756 
  6757   if (NETCONN_P (proc))
  6758     wait_while_connecting (proc);
  6759 
  6760   send_process (proc, (char *) BYTE_POS_ADDR (start_byte),
  6761                 end_byte - start_byte, Fcurrent_buffer ());
  6762 
  6763   return Qnil;
  6764 }
  6765 
  6766 DEFUN ("process-send-string", Fprocess_send_string, Sprocess_send_string,
  6767        2, 2, 0,
  6768        doc: /* Send PROCESS the contents of STRING as input.
  6769 PROCESS may be a process, a buffer, the name of a process or buffer, or
  6770 nil, indicating the current buffer's process.
  6771 If STRING is larger than the input buffer of the process (the length
  6772 of which depends on the process connection type and the operating
  6773 system), it is sent in several bunches.  This may happen even for
  6774 shorter strings.  Output from processes can arrive in between bunches.
  6775 
  6776 If PROCESS is a non-blocking network process that hasn't been fully
  6777 set up yet, this function will block until socket setup has completed.  */)
  6778   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object string)
  6779 {
  6780   CHECK_STRING (string);
  6781   Lisp_Object proc = get_process (process);
  6782   send_process (proc, SSDATA (string),
  6783                 SBYTES (string), string);
  6784   return Qnil;
  6785 }
  6786 
  6787 /* Return the foreground process group for the tty/pty that
  6788    the process P uses.  */
  6789 static pid_t
  6790 emacs_get_tty_pgrp (struct Lisp_Process *p)
  6791 {
  6792   pid_t gid = -1;
  6793 
  6794 #ifdef TIOCGPGRP
  6795   if (ioctl (p->infd, TIOCGPGRP, &gid) == -1 && ! NILP (p->tty_name))
  6796     {
  6797       int fd;
  6798       /* Some OS:es (Solaris 8/9) does not allow TIOCGPGRP from the
  6799          master side.  Try the slave side.  */
  6800       fd = emacs_open (SSDATA (p->tty_name), O_RDONLY, 0);
  6801 
  6802       if (fd != -1)
  6803         {
  6804           ioctl (fd, TIOCGPGRP, &gid);
  6805           emacs_close (fd);
  6806         }
  6807     }
  6808 #endif /* defined (TIOCGPGRP ) */
  6809 
  6810   return gid;
  6811 }
  6812 
  6813 DEFUN ("process-running-child-p", Fprocess_running_child_p,
  6814        Sprocess_running_child_p, 0, 1, 0,
  6815        doc: /* Return non-nil if PROCESS has given control of its terminal to a child.
  6816 If the operating system does not make it possible to find out, return t.
  6817 If it's possible to find out, return the numeric ID of the foreground
  6818 process group if PROCESS did give control of its terminal to a
  6819 child process, and return nil if it didn't.
  6820 
  6821 PROCESS must be a real subprocess, not a connection.  */)
  6822   (Lisp_Object process)
  6823 {
  6824   /* Initialize in case ioctl doesn't exist or gives an error,
  6825      in a way that will cause returning t.  */
  6826   Lisp_Object proc = get_process (process);
  6827   struct Lisp_Process *p = XPROCESS (proc);
  6828 
  6829   if (!EQ (p->type, Qreal))
  6830     error ("Process %s is not a subprocess",
  6831            SDATA (p->name));
  6832   if (p->infd < 0)
  6833     error ("Process %s is not active",
  6834            SDATA (p->name));
  6835 
  6836   pid_t gid = emacs_get_tty_pgrp (p);
  6837 
  6838   if (gid == p->pid)
  6839     return Qnil;
  6840   if (gid != -1)
  6841     return make_fixnum (gid);
  6842   return Qt;
  6843 }
  6844 
  6845 /* Send a signal number SIGNO to PROCESS.
  6846    If CURRENT_GROUP is t, that means send to the process group
  6847    that currently owns the terminal being used to communicate with PROCESS.
  6848    This is used for various commands in shell mode.
  6849    If CURRENT_GROUP is lambda, that means send to the process group
  6850    that currently owns the terminal, but only if it is NOT the shell itself.
  6851 
  6852    If NOMSG is false, insert signal-announcements into process's buffers
  6853    right away.
  6854 
  6855    If we can, we try to signal PROCESS by sending control characters
  6856    down the pty.  This allows us to signal inferiors who have changed
  6857    their uid, for which kill would return an EPERM error.  */
  6858 
  6859 static void
  6860 process_send_signal (Lisp_Object process, int signo, Lisp_Object current_group,
  6861                      bool nomsg)
  6862 {
  6863   Lisp_Object proc;
  6864   struct Lisp_Process *p;
  6865   pid_t gid;
  6866   bool no_pgrp = 0;
  6867 
  6868   proc = get_process (process);
  6869   p = XPROCESS (proc);
  6870 
  6871   if (!EQ (p->type, Qreal))
  6872     error ("Process %s is not a subprocess",
  6873            SDATA (p->name));
  6874   if (p->infd < 0)
  6875     error ("Process %s is not active",
  6876            SDATA (p->name));
  6877 
  6878   if (! p->pty_in)
  6879     current_group = Qnil;
  6880 
  6881   /* If we are using pgrps, get a pgrp number and make it negative.  */
  6882   if (NILP (current_group))
  6883     /* Send the signal to the shell's process group.  */
  6884     gid = p->pid;
  6885   else
  6886     {
  6887 #ifdef SIGNALS_VIA_CHARACTERS
  6888       /* If possible, send signals to the entire pgrp
  6889          by sending an input character to it.  */
  6890 
  6891       struct termios t;
  6892       cc_t *sig_char = NULL;
  6893 
  6894       tcgetattr (p->infd, &t);
  6895 
  6896       switch (signo)
  6897         {
  6898         case SIGINT:
  6899           sig_char = &t.c_cc[VINTR];
  6900           break;
  6901 
  6902         case SIGQUIT:
  6903           sig_char = &t.c_cc[VQUIT];
  6904           break;
  6905 
  6906         case SIGTSTP:
  6907 #ifdef VSWTCH
  6908           sig_char = &t.c_cc[VSWTCH];
  6909 #else
  6910           sig_char = &t.c_cc[VSUSP];
  6911 #endif
  6912           break;
  6913         }
  6914 
  6915       if (sig_char && *sig_char != CDISABLE)
  6916         {
  6917           send_process (proc, (char *) sig_char, 1, Qnil);
  6918           return;
  6919         }
  6920       /* If we can't send the signal with a character,
  6921          fall through and send it another way.  */
  6922 
  6923       /* The code above may fall through if it can't
  6924          handle the signal.  */
  6925 #endif /* defined (SIGNALS_VIA_CHARACTERS) */
  6926 
  6927 #ifdef TIOCGPGRP
  6928       /* Get the current pgrp using the tty itself, if we have that.
  6929          Otherwise, use the pty to get the pgrp.
  6930          On pfa systems, saka@pfu.fujitsu.co.JP writes:
  6931          "TIOCGPGRP symbol defined in sys/ioctl.h at E50.
  6932          But, TIOCGPGRP does not work on E50 ;-P works fine on E60"
  6933          His patch indicates that if TIOCGPGRP returns an error, then
  6934          we should just assume that p->pid is also the process group id.  */
  6935 
  6936       gid = emacs_get_tty_pgrp (p);
  6937 
  6938       if (gid == -1)
  6939         /* If we can't get the information, assume
  6940            the shell owns the tty.  */
  6941         gid = p->pid;
  6942 
  6943       /* It is not clear whether anything really can set GID to -1.
  6944          Perhaps on some system one of those ioctls can or could do so.
  6945          Or perhaps this is vestigial.  */
  6946       if (gid == -1)
  6947         no_pgrp = 1;
  6948 #else  /* ! defined (TIOCGPGRP) */
  6949       /* Can't select pgrps on this system, so we know that
  6950          the child itself heads the pgrp.  */
  6951       gid = p->pid;
  6952 #endif /* ! defined (TIOCGPGRP) */
  6953 
  6954       /* If current_group is lambda, and the shell owns the terminal,
  6955          don't send any signal.  */
  6956       if (EQ (current_group, Qlambda) && gid == p->pid)
  6957         return;
  6958     }
  6959 
  6960 #ifdef SIGCONT
  6961   if (signo == SIGCONT)
  6962     {
  6963       p->raw_status_new = 0;
  6964       pset_status (p, Qrun);
  6965       p->tick = ++process_tick;
  6966       if (!nomsg)
  6967         {
  6968           status_notify (NULL, NULL);
  6969           redisplay_preserve_echo_area (13);
  6970         }
  6971     }
  6972 #endif
  6973 
  6974 #ifdef TIOCSIGSEND
  6975   /* Work around a HP-UX 7.0 bug that mishandles signals to subjobs.
  6976      We don't know whether the bug is fixed in later HP-UX versions.  */
  6977   if (! NILP (current_group) && ioctl (p->infd, TIOCSIGSEND, signo) != -1)
  6978     return;
  6979 #endif
  6980 
  6981   /* If we don't have process groups, send the signal to the immediate
  6982      subprocess.  That isn't really right, but it's better than any
  6983      obvious alternative.  */
  6984   pid_t pid = no_pgrp ? gid : - gid;
  6985 
  6986   /* Do not kill an already-reaped process, as that could kill an
  6987      innocent bystander that happens to have the same process ID.  */
  6988   sigset_t oldset;
  6989   block_child_signal (&oldset);
  6990   if (p->alive)
  6991     kill (pid, signo);
  6992   unblock_child_signal (&oldset);
  6993 }
  6994 
  6995 DEFUN ("internal-default-interrupt-process",
  6996        Finternal_default_interrupt_process,
  6997        Sinternal_default_interrupt_process, 0, 2, 0,
  6998        doc: /* Default function to interrupt process PROCESS.
  6999 It shall be the last element in list `interrupt-process-functions'.
  7000 See function `interrupt-process' for more details on usage.  */)
  7001   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object current_group)
  7002 {
  7003   process_send_signal (process, SIGINT, current_group, 0);
  7004   return process;
  7005 }
  7006 
  7007 DEFUN ("interrupt-process", Finterrupt_process, Sinterrupt_process, 0, 2, 0,
  7008        doc: /* Interrupt process PROCESS.
  7009 PROCESS may be a process, a buffer, or the name of a process or buffer.
  7010 No arg or nil means current buffer's process.
  7011 Second arg CURRENT-GROUP non-nil means send signal to
  7012 the current process-group of the process's controlling terminal
  7013 rather than to the process's own process group.
  7014 If the process is a shell, this means interrupt current subjob
  7015 rather than the shell.
  7016 
  7017 If CURRENT-GROUP is `lambda', and if the shell owns the terminal,
  7018 don't send the signal.
  7019 
  7020 This function calls the functions of `interrupt-process-functions' in
  7021 the order of the list, until one of them returns non-nil.  */)
  7022   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object current_group)
  7023 {
  7024   return CALLN (Frun_hook_with_args_until_success, Qinterrupt_process_functions,
  7025                 process, current_group);
  7026 }
  7027 
  7028 DEFUN ("kill-process", Fkill_process, Skill_process, 0, 2,
  7029        "(list (read-process-name \"Kill process\"))",
  7030        doc: /* Kill process PROCESS.  May be process or name of one.
  7031 See function `interrupt-process' for more details on usage.  */)
  7032   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object current_group)
  7033 {
  7034   process_send_signal (process, SIGKILL, current_group, 0);
  7035   return process;
  7036 }
  7037 
  7038 DEFUN ("quit-process", Fquit_process, Squit_process, 0, 2, 0,
  7039        doc: /* Send QUIT signal to process PROCESS.  May be process or name of one.
  7040 See function `interrupt-process' for more details on usage.  */)
  7041   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object current_group)
  7042 {
  7043   process_send_signal (process, SIGQUIT, current_group, 0);
  7044   return process;
  7045 }
  7046 
  7047 DEFUN ("stop-process", Fstop_process, Sstop_process, 0, 2, 0,
  7048        doc: /* Stop process PROCESS.  May be process or name of one.
  7049 See function `interrupt-process' for more details on usage.
  7050 If PROCESS is a network or serial or pipe connection, inhibit handling
  7051 of incoming traffic.  */)
  7052   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object current_group)
  7053 {
  7054   if (PROCESSP (process) && (NETCONN_P (process) || SERIALCONN_P (process)
  7055                              || PIPECONN_P (process)))
  7056     {
  7057       struct Lisp_Process *p;
  7058 
  7059       p = XPROCESS (process);
  7060       if (NILP (p->command)
  7061           && p->infd >= 0)
  7062         delete_read_fd (p->infd);
  7063       pset_command (p, Qt);
  7064       return process;
  7065     }
  7066 #ifndef SIGTSTP
  7067   error ("No SIGTSTP support");
  7068 #else
  7069   process_send_signal (process, SIGTSTP, current_group, 0);
  7070 #endif
  7071   return process;
  7072 }
  7073 
  7074 DEFUN ("continue-process", Fcontinue_process, Scontinue_process, 0, 2, 0,
  7075        doc: /* Continue process PROCESS.  May be process or name of one.
  7076 See function `interrupt-process' for more details on usage.
  7077 If PROCESS is a network or serial process, resume handling of incoming
  7078 traffic.  */)
  7079   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object current_group)
  7080 {
  7081   if (PROCESSP (process) && (NETCONN_P (process) || SERIALCONN_P (process)
  7082                              || PIPECONN_P (process)))
  7083     {
  7084       struct Lisp_Process *p;
  7085 
  7086       p = XPROCESS (process);
  7087       eassert (p->infd < FD_SETSIZE);
  7088       if (EQ (p->command, Qt)
  7089           && p->infd >= 0
  7090           && (!EQ (p->filter, Qt) || EQ (p->status, Qlisten)))
  7091         {
  7092           add_process_read_fd (p->infd);
  7093 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
  7094           if (fd_info[ p->infd ].flags & FILE_SERIAL)
  7095             PurgeComm (fd_info[ p->infd ].hnd, PURGE_RXABORT | PURGE_RXCLEAR);
  7096 #else /* not WINDOWSNT */
  7097           tcflush (p->infd, TCIFLUSH);
  7098 #endif /* not WINDOWSNT */
  7099         }
  7100       pset_command (p, Qnil);
  7101       return process;
  7102     }
  7103 #ifdef SIGCONT
  7104     process_send_signal (process, SIGCONT, current_group, 0);
  7105 #else
  7106     error ("No SIGCONT support");
  7107 #endif
  7108   return process;
  7109 }
  7110 
  7111 /* Return the integer value of the signal whose abbreviation is ABBR,
  7112    or a negative number if there is no such signal.  */
  7113 static int
  7114 abbr_to_signal (char const *name)
  7115 {
  7116   int i, signo;
  7117   char sigbuf[20]; /* Large enough for all valid signal abbreviations.  */
  7118 
  7119   if (!strncmp (name, "SIG", 3) || !strncmp (name, "sig", 3))
  7120     name += 3;
  7121 
  7122   for (i = 0; i < sizeof sigbuf; i++)
  7123     {
  7124       sigbuf[i] = c_toupper (name[i]);
  7125       if (! sigbuf[i])
  7126         return str2sig (sigbuf, &signo) == 0 ? signo : -1;
  7127     }
  7128 
  7129   return -1;
  7130 }
  7131 
  7132 DEFUN ("internal-default-signal-process",
  7133        Finternal_default_signal_process,
  7134        Sinternal_default_signal_process, 2, 3, 0,
  7135        doc: /* Default function to send PROCESS the signal with code SIGCODE.
  7136 It shall be the last element in list `signal-process-functions'.
  7137 See function `signal-process' for more details on usage.  */)
  7138   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object sigcode, Lisp_Object remote)
  7139 {
  7140   pid_t pid;
  7141   int signo;
  7142 
  7143   if (STRINGP (process))
  7144     {
  7145       Lisp_Object tem = Fget_process (process);
  7146       if (NILP (tem))
  7147         {
  7148           ptrdiff_t len;
  7149           tem = string_to_number (SSDATA (process), 10, &len);
  7150           if (NILP (tem) || len != SBYTES (process))
  7151             return Qnil;
  7152         }
  7153       process = tem;
  7154     }
  7155   else if (!NUMBERP (process))
  7156     process = get_process (process);
  7157 
  7158   if (NILP (process))
  7159     return process;
  7160 
  7161   if (NUMBERP (process))
  7162     CONS_TO_INTEGER (process, pid_t, pid);
  7163   else
  7164     {
  7165       CHECK_PROCESS (process);
  7166       pid = XPROCESS (process)->pid;
  7167       if (pid <= 0)
  7168         error ("Cannot signal process %s", SDATA (XPROCESS (process)->name));
  7169     }
  7170 
  7171   if (FIXNUMP (sigcode))
  7172     signo = check_integer_range (sigcode, INT_MIN, INT_MAX);
  7173   else
  7174     {
  7175       char *name;
  7176 
  7177       CHECK_SYMBOL (sigcode);
  7178       name = SSDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (sigcode));
  7179 
  7180       signo = abbr_to_signal (name);
  7181       if (signo < 0)
  7182         error ("Undefined signal name %s", name);
  7183     }
  7184 
  7185   return make_fixnum (kill (pid, signo));
  7186 }
  7187 
  7188 DEFUN ("signal-process", Fsignal_process, Ssignal_process,
  7189        2, 3, "(list (read-string \"Process (name or number): \") (read-signal-name))",
  7190        doc: /* Send PROCESS the signal with code SIGCODE.
  7191 PROCESS may also be a number specifying the process id of the
  7192 process to signal; in this case, the process need not be a child of
  7193 this Emacs.
  7194 If PROCESS is a process object which contains the property
  7195 `remote-pid', or PROCESS is a number and REMOTE is a remote file name,
  7196 PROCESS is interpreted as process on the respective remote host, which
  7197 will be the process to signal.
  7198 SIGCODE may be an integer, or a symbol whose name is a signal name.  */)
  7199   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object sigcode, Lisp_Object remote)
  7200 {
  7201   return CALLN (Frun_hook_with_args_until_success, Qsignal_process_functions,
  7202                 process, sigcode, remote);
  7203 }
  7204 
  7205 DEFUN ("process-send-eof", Fprocess_send_eof, Sprocess_send_eof, 0, 1, 0,
  7206        doc: /* Make PROCESS see end-of-file in its input.
  7207 EOF comes after any text already sent to it.
  7208 PROCESS may be a process, a buffer, the name of a process or buffer, or
  7209 nil, indicating the current buffer's process.
  7210 If PROCESS is a network connection, or is a process communicating
  7211 through a pipe (as opposed to a pty), then you cannot send any more
  7212 text to PROCESS after you call this function.
  7213 If PROCESS is a serial process, wait until all output written to the
  7214 process has been transmitted to the serial port.  */)
  7215   (Lisp_Object process)
  7216 {
  7217   Lisp_Object proc;
  7218   struct coding_system *coding = NULL;
  7219   int outfd;
  7220 
  7221   proc = get_process (process);
  7222 
  7223   if (NETCONN_P (proc))
  7224     wait_while_connecting (proc);
  7225 
  7226   if (DATAGRAM_CONN_P (proc))
  7227     return process;
  7228 
  7229 
  7230   outfd = XPROCESS (proc)->outfd;
  7231   eassert (outfd < FD_SETSIZE);
  7232   if (outfd >= 0)
  7233     coding = proc_encode_coding_system[outfd];
  7234 
  7235   /* Make sure the process is really alive.  */
  7236   if (XPROCESS (proc)->raw_status_new)
  7237     update_status (XPROCESS (proc));
  7238   if (! EQ (XPROCESS (proc)->status, Qrun))
  7239     error ("Process %s not running: %s", SDATA (XPROCESS (proc)->name), SDATA (status_message (XPROCESS (proc))));
  7240 
  7241   if (coding && CODING_REQUIRE_FLUSHING (coding))
  7242     {
  7243       coding->mode |= CODING_MODE_LAST_BLOCK;
  7244       send_process (proc, "", 0, Qnil);
  7245     }
  7246 
  7247   if (XPROCESS (proc)->pty_in)
  7248     send_process (proc, "\004", 1, Qnil);
  7249   else if (EQ (XPROCESS (proc)->type, Qserial))
  7250     {
  7251 #if !defined WINDOWSNT && defined HAVE_TCDRAIN
  7252       if (tcdrain (XPROCESS (proc)->outfd) != 0)
  7253         report_file_error ("Failed tcdrain", Qnil);
  7254 #endif /* not WINDOWSNT */
  7255       /* Do nothing on Windows because writes are blocking.  */
  7256     }
  7257   else
  7258     {
  7259       struct Lisp_Process *p = XPROCESS (proc);
  7260       int old_outfd = p->outfd;
  7261       int new_outfd;
  7262 
  7263 #ifdef HAVE_SHUTDOWN
  7264       /* If this is a network connection, or socketpair is used
  7265          for communication with the subprocess, call shutdown to cause EOF.
  7266          (In some old system, shutdown to socketpair doesn't work.
  7267          Then we just can't win.)  */
  7268       if (0 <= old_outfd
  7269           && (EQ (p->type, Qnetwork) || p->infd == old_outfd))
  7270         shutdown (old_outfd, 1);
  7271 #endif
  7272       close_process_fd (&p->open_fd[WRITE_TO_SUBPROCESS]);
  7273       new_outfd = emacs_open (NULL_DEVICE, O_WRONLY, 0);
  7274       if (new_outfd < 0)
  7275         report_file_error ("Opening null device", Qnil);
  7276       p->open_fd[WRITE_TO_SUBPROCESS] = new_outfd;
  7277       p->outfd = new_outfd;
  7278 
  7279       eassert (0 <= new_outfd && new_outfd < FD_SETSIZE);
  7280       if (!proc_encode_coding_system[new_outfd])
  7281         proc_encode_coding_system[new_outfd]
  7282           = xmalloc (sizeof (struct coding_system));
  7283       if (old_outfd >= 0)
  7284         {
  7285           eassert (old_outfd < FD_SETSIZE);
  7286           *proc_encode_coding_system[new_outfd]
  7287             = *proc_encode_coding_system[old_outfd];
  7288           memset (proc_encode_coding_system[old_outfd], 0,
  7289                   sizeof (struct coding_system));
  7290         }
  7291       else
  7292         setup_coding_system (p->encode_coding_system,
  7293                              proc_encode_coding_system[new_outfd]);
  7294     }
  7295   return process;
  7296 }
  7297 
  7298 /* The main Emacs thread records child processes in three places:
  7299 
  7300    - Vprocess_alist, for asynchronous subprocesses, which are child
  7301      processes visible to Lisp.
  7302 
  7303    - deleted_pid_list, for child processes invisible to Lisp,
  7304      typically because of delete-process.  These are recorded so that
  7305      the processes can be reaped when they exit, so that the operating
  7306      system's process table is not cluttered by zombies.
  7307 
  7308    - the local variable PID in Fcall_process, call_process_cleanup and
  7309      call_process_kill, for synchronous subprocesses.
  7310      record_unwind_protect is used to make sure this process is not
  7311      forgotten: if the user interrupts call-process and the child
  7312      process refuses to exit immediately even with two C-g's,
  7313      call_process_kill adds PID's contents to deleted_pid_list before
  7314      returning.
  7315 
  7316    The main Emacs thread invokes waitpid only on child processes that
  7317    it creates and that have not been reaped.  This avoid races on
  7318    platforms such as GTK, where other threads create their own
  7319    subprocesses which the main thread should not reap.  For example,
  7320    if the main thread attempted to reap an already-reaped child, it
  7321    might inadvertently reap a GTK-created process that happened to
  7322    have the same process ID.
  7323 
  7324    To avoid a deadlock when receiving SIGCHLD while
  7325    'wait_reading_process_output' is in 'pselect', the SIGCHLD handler
  7326    will notify the `pselect' using a self-pipe.  The deadlock could
  7327    occur if SIGCHLD is delivered outside of the 'pselect' call, in
  7328    which case 'pselect' will not be interrupted by the signal, and
  7329    will therefore wait on the process's output descriptor for the
  7330    output that will never come.
  7331 
  7332    WINDOWSNT doesn't need this facility because its 'pselect'
  7333    emulation (see 'sys_select' in w32proc.c) waits on a subprocess
  7334    handle, which becomes signaled when the process exits, and also
  7335    because that emulation delays the delivery of the simulated SIGCHLD
  7336    until all the output from the subprocess has been consumed.  */
  7337 
  7338 /* FIXME: On Unix-like systems that have a proper 'pselect'
  7339    (HAVE_PSELECT), we should block SIGCHLD in
  7340    'wait_reading_process_output' and pass a non-NULL signal mask to
  7341    'pselect' to avoid the need for the self-pipe.  */
  7342 
  7343 /* Set up `child_signal_read_fd' and `child_signal_write_fd'.  */
  7344 
  7345 void
  7346 child_signal_init (void)
  7347 {
  7348   /* Either both are initialized, or both are uninitialized.  */
  7349   eassert ((child_signal_read_fd < 0) == (child_signal_write_fd < 0));
  7350 
  7351 #ifndef WINDOWSNT
  7352   if (0 <= child_signal_read_fd)
  7353     return; /* already done */
  7354 
  7355   int fds[2];
  7356   if (emacs_pipe (fds) < 0)
  7357     report_file_error ("Creating pipe for child signal", Qnil);
  7358   if (FD_SETSIZE <= fds[0])
  7359     {
  7360       /* Since we need to `pselect' on the read end, it has to fit
  7361          into an `fd_set'.  */
  7362       emacs_close (fds[0]);
  7363       emacs_close (fds[1]);
  7364       report_file_errno ("Creating pipe for child signal", Qnil,
  7365                          EMFILE);
  7366     }
  7367 
  7368   /* We leave the file descriptors open until the Emacs process
  7369      exits.  */
  7370   eassert (0 <= fds[0]);
  7371   eassert (0 <= fds[1]);
  7372   if (fcntl (fds[0], F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK) != 0)
  7373     emacs_perror ("fcntl");
  7374   if (fcntl (fds[1], F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK) != 0)
  7375     emacs_perror ("fcntl");
  7376   add_read_fd (fds[0], child_signal_read, NULL);
  7377   fd_callback_info[fds[0]].flags &= ~KEYBOARD_FD;
  7378   child_signal_read_fd = fds[0];
  7379   child_signal_write_fd = fds[1];
  7380 #endif  /* !WINDOWSNT */
  7381 }
  7382 
  7383 #ifndef WINDOWSNT
  7384 /* Consume a process status change.  */
  7385 
  7386 static void
  7387 child_signal_read (int fd, void *data)
  7388 {
  7389   eassert (0 <= fd);
  7390   eassert (fd == child_signal_read_fd);
  7391   char dummy;
  7392   if (emacs_read (fd, &dummy, 1) < 0 && errno != EAGAIN)
  7393     emacs_perror ("reading from child signal FD");
  7394 }
  7395 #endif  /* !WINDOWSNT */
  7396 
  7397 /* Notify `wait_reading_process_output' of a process status
  7398    change.  */
  7399 
  7400 static void
  7401 child_signal_notify (void)
  7402 {
  7403 #ifndef WINDOWSNT
  7404   int fd = child_signal_write_fd;
  7405   eassert (0 <= fd);
  7406   char dummy = 0;
  7407   if (emacs_write (fd, &dummy, 1) != 1)
  7408     emacs_perror ("writing to child signal FD");
  7409 #endif
  7410 }
  7411 
  7412 /* LIB_CHILD_HANDLER is a SIGCHLD handler that Emacs calls while doing
  7413    its own SIGCHLD handling.  On POSIXish systems lacking
  7414    pidfd_open+waitid or using Glib 2.73.1-, Glib needs this to
  7415    keep track of its own children.  GNUstep is similar.  */
  7416 
  7417 static void dummy_handler (int sig) {}
  7418 static signal_handler_t volatile lib_child_handler;
  7419 
  7420 /* Handle a SIGCHLD signal by looking for known child processes of
  7421    Emacs whose status have changed.  For each one found, record its
  7422    new status.
  7423 
  7424    All we do is change the status; we do not run sentinels or print
  7425    notifications.  That is saved for the next time keyboard input is
  7426    done, in order to avoid timing errors.
  7427 
  7428    ** WARNING: this can be called during garbage collection.
  7429    Therefore, it must not be fooled by the presence of mark bits in
  7430    Lisp objects.
  7431 
  7432    ** USG WARNING: Although it is not obvious from the documentation
  7433    in signal(2), on a USG system the SIGCLD handler MUST NOT call
  7434    signal() before executing at least one wait(), otherwise the
  7435    handler will be called again, resulting in an infinite loop.  The
  7436    relevant portion of the documentation reads "SIGCLD signals will be
  7437    queued and the signal-catching function will be continually
  7438    reentered until the queue is empty".  Invoking signal() causes the
  7439    kernel to reexamine the SIGCLD queue.  Fred Fish, UniSoft Systems
  7440    Inc.
  7441 
  7442    ** Malloc WARNING: This should never call malloc either directly or
  7443    indirectly; if it does, that is a bug.  */
  7444 
  7445 static void
  7446 handle_child_signal (int sig)
  7447 {
  7448   Lisp_Object tail, proc;
  7449   bool changed = false;
  7450 
  7451   /* Find the process that signaled us, and record its status.  */
  7452 
  7453   /* The process can have been deleted by Fdelete_process, or have
  7454      been started asynchronously by Fcall_process.  */
  7455   for (tail = deleted_pid_list; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  7456     {
  7457       bool all_pids_are_fixnums
  7458         = (MOST_NEGATIVE_FIXNUM <= TYPE_MINIMUM (pid_t)
  7459            && TYPE_MAXIMUM (pid_t) <= MOST_POSITIVE_FIXNUM);
  7460       Lisp_Object head = XCAR (tail);
  7461       Lisp_Object xpid;
  7462       if (! CONSP (head))
  7463         continue;
  7464       xpid = XCAR (head);
  7465       if (all_pids_are_fixnums ? FIXNUMP (xpid) : INTEGERP (xpid))
  7466         {
  7467           intmax_t deleted_pid;
  7468           bool ok = integer_to_intmax (xpid, &deleted_pid);
  7469           eassert (ok);
  7470           if (child_status_changed (deleted_pid, 0, 0))
  7471             {
  7472               changed = true;
  7473               if (STRINGP (XCDR (head)))
  7474                 unlink (SSDATA (XCDR (head)));
  7475               XSETCAR (tail, Qnil);
  7476             }
  7477         }
  7478     }
  7479 
  7480   /* Otherwise, if it is asynchronous, it is in Vprocess_alist.  */
  7481   FOR_EACH_PROCESS (tail, proc)
  7482     {
  7483       struct Lisp_Process *p = XPROCESS (proc);
  7484       int status;
  7485 
  7486       if (p->alive
  7487           && child_status_changed (p->pid, &status, WUNTRACED | WCONTINUED))
  7488         {
  7489           /* Change the status of the process that was found.  */
  7490           changed = true;
  7491           p->tick = ++process_tick;
  7492           p->raw_status = status;
  7493           p->raw_status_new = 1;
  7494 
  7495           /* If process has terminated, stop waiting for its output.  */
  7496           if (WIFSIGNALED (status) || WIFEXITED (status))
  7497             {
  7498               bool clear_desc_flag = 0;
  7499               p->alive = 0;
  7500               if (p->infd >= 0)
  7501                 clear_desc_flag = 1;
  7502 
  7503               /* clear_desc_flag avoids a compiler bug in Microsoft C.  */
  7504               if (clear_desc_flag)
  7505                 delete_read_fd (p->infd);
  7506             }
  7507         }
  7508     }
  7509 
  7510   if (changed)
  7511     /* Wake up `wait_reading_process_output'.  */
  7512     child_signal_notify ();
  7513 
  7514   lib_child_handler (sig);
  7515 #ifdef NS_IMPL_GNUSTEP
  7516   /* NSTask in GNUstep sets its child handler each time it is called.
  7517      So we must re-set ours.  */
  7518   catch_child_signal ();
  7519 #endif
  7520 }
  7521 
  7522 static void
  7523 deliver_child_signal (int sig)
  7524 {
  7525   deliver_process_signal (sig, handle_child_signal);
  7526 }
  7527 
  7528 
  7529 static Lisp_Object
  7530 exec_sentinel_error_handler (Lisp_Object error_val)
  7531 {
  7532   /* Make sure error_val is a cons cell, as all the rest of error
  7533      handling expects that, and will barf otherwise.  */
  7534   if (!CONSP (error_val))
  7535     error_val = Fcons (Qerror, error_val);
  7536   cmd_error_internal (error_val, "error in process sentinel: ");
  7537   Vinhibit_quit = Qt;
  7538   update_echo_area ();
  7539   if (process_error_pause_time > 0)
  7540     Fsleep_for (make_fixnum (process_error_pause_time), Qnil);
  7541   return Qt;
  7542 }
  7543 
  7544 static void
  7545 exec_sentinel (Lisp_Object proc, Lisp_Object reason)
  7546 {
  7547   Lisp_Object sentinel, odeactivate;
  7548   struct Lisp_Process *p = XPROCESS (proc);
  7549   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  7550   bool outer_running_asynch_code = running_asynch_code;
  7551   int waiting = waiting_for_user_input_p;
  7552 
  7553   if (inhibit_sentinels)
  7554     return;
  7555 
  7556   odeactivate = Vdeactivate_mark;
  7557 #if 0
  7558   Lisp_Object obuffer, okeymap;
  7559   XSETBUFFER (obuffer, current_buffer);
  7560   okeymap = BVAR (current_buffer, keymap);
  7561 #endif
  7562 
  7563   /* There's no good reason to let sentinels change the current
  7564      buffer, and many callers of accept-process-output, sit-for, and
  7565      friends don't expect current-buffer to be changed from under them.  */
  7566   record_unwind_current_buffer ();
  7567 
  7568   sentinel = p->sentinel;
  7569 
  7570   /* Inhibit quit so that random quits don't screw up a running filter.  */
  7571   specbind (Qinhibit_quit, Qt);
  7572   specbind (Qlast_nonmenu_event, Qt); /* Why? --Stef  */
  7573 
  7574   /* In case we get recursively called,
  7575      and we already saved the match data nonrecursively,
  7576      save the same match data in safely recursive fashion.  */
  7577   if (outer_running_asynch_code)
  7578     {
  7579       Lisp_Object tem;
  7580       tem = Fmatch_data (Qnil, Qnil, Qnil);
  7581       restore_search_regs ();
  7582       record_unwind_save_match_data ();
  7583       Fset_match_data (tem, Qt);
  7584     }
  7585 
  7586   /* For speed, if a search happens within this code,
  7587      save the match data in a special nonrecursive fashion.  */
  7588   running_asynch_code = 1;
  7589 
  7590   internal_condition_case_1 (read_process_output_call,
  7591                              list3 (sentinel, proc, reason),
  7592                              !NILP (Vdebug_on_error) ? Qnil : Qerror,
  7593                              exec_sentinel_error_handler);
  7594 
  7595   /* If we saved the match data nonrecursively, restore it now.  */
  7596   restore_search_regs ();
  7597   running_asynch_code = outer_running_asynch_code;
  7598 
  7599   Vdeactivate_mark = odeactivate;
  7600 
  7601   /* Restore waiting_for_user_input_p as it was
  7602      when we were called, in case the filter clobbered it.  */
  7603   waiting_for_user_input_p = waiting;
  7604 
  7605   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  7606 }
  7607 
  7608 /* Report all recent events of a change in process status
  7609    (either run the sentinel or output a message).
  7610    This is usually done while Emacs is waiting for keyboard input
  7611    but can be done at other times.
  7612 
  7613    Return positive if any input was received from WAIT_PROC (or from
  7614    any process if WAIT_PROC is null), zero if input was attempted but
  7615    none received, and negative if we didn't even try.  */
  7616 
  7617 static int
  7618 status_notify (struct Lisp_Process *deleting_process,
  7619                struct Lisp_Process *wait_proc)
  7620 {
  7621   Lisp_Object proc;
  7622   Lisp_Object tail, msg;
  7623   int got_some_output = -1;
  7624 
  7625   tail = Qnil;
  7626   msg = Qnil;
  7627 
  7628   /* Set this now, so that if new processes are created by sentinels
  7629      that we run, we get called again to handle their status changes.  */
  7630   update_tick = process_tick;
  7631 
  7632   FOR_EACH_PROCESS (tail, proc)
  7633     {
  7634       Lisp_Object symbol;
  7635       register struct Lisp_Process *p = XPROCESS (proc);
  7636 
  7637       if (p->tick != p->update_tick)
  7638         {
  7639           p->update_tick = p->tick;
  7640 
  7641           /* If process is still active, read any output that remains.  */
  7642           while (! EQ (p->filter, Qt)
  7643                  && ! connecting_status (p->status)
  7644                  && ! EQ (p->status, Qlisten)
  7645                  /* Network or serial process not stopped:  */
  7646                  && ! EQ (p->command, Qt)
  7647                  && p->infd >= 0
  7648                  && p != deleting_process)
  7649             {
  7650               int nread = read_process_output (proc, p->infd);
  7651               if ((!wait_proc || wait_proc == XPROCESS (proc))
  7652                   && got_some_output < nread)
  7653                 got_some_output = nread;
  7654               if (nread <= 0)
  7655                 break;
  7656             }
  7657 
  7658           /* Get the text to use for the message.  */
  7659           if (p->raw_status_new)
  7660             update_status (p);
  7661           msg = status_message (p);
  7662 
  7663           /* If process is terminated, deactivate it or delete it.  */
  7664           symbol = p->status;
  7665           if (CONSP (p->status))
  7666             symbol = XCAR (p->status);
  7667 
  7668           if (EQ (symbol, Qsignal) || EQ (symbol, Qexit)
  7669               || EQ (symbol, Qclosed))
  7670             {
  7671               if (delete_exited_processes)
  7672                 remove_process (proc);
  7673               else
  7674                 deactivate_process (proc);
  7675             }
  7676 
  7677           /* The actions above may have further incremented p->tick.
  7678              So set p->update_tick again so that an error in the sentinel will
  7679              not cause this code to be run again.  */
  7680           p->update_tick = p->tick;
  7681           /* Now output the message suitably.  */
  7682           exec_sentinel (proc, msg);
  7683           if (BUFFERP (p->buffer))
  7684             /* In case it uses %s in mode-line-format.  */
  7685             bset_update_mode_line (XBUFFER (p->buffer));
  7686         }
  7687     } /* end for */
  7688 
  7689   return got_some_output;
  7690 }
  7691 
  7692 DEFUN ("internal-default-process-sentinel", Finternal_default_process_sentinel,
  7693        Sinternal_default_process_sentinel, 2, 2, 0,
  7694        doc: /* Function used as default sentinel for processes.
  7695 This inserts a status message into the process's buffer, if there is one.  */)
  7696      (Lisp_Object proc, Lisp_Object msg)
  7697 {
  7698   Lisp_Object buffer, symbol;
  7699   struct Lisp_Process *p;
  7700   CHECK_PROCESS (proc);
  7701   p = XPROCESS (proc);
  7702   buffer = p->buffer;
  7703   symbol = p->status;
  7704   if (CONSP (symbol))
  7705     symbol = XCAR (symbol);
  7706 
  7707   if (!EQ (symbol, Qrun) && !NILP (buffer))
  7708     {
  7709       Lisp_Object tem;
  7710       struct buffer *old = current_buffer;
  7711       ptrdiff_t opoint, opoint_byte;
  7712       ptrdiff_t before, before_byte;
  7713 
  7714       /* Avoid error if buffer is deleted
  7715          (probably that's why the process is dead, too).  */
  7716       if (!BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (buffer)))
  7717         return Qnil;
  7718       Fset_buffer (buffer);
  7719 
  7720       if (NILP (BVAR (current_buffer, enable_multibyte_characters)))
  7721         msg = (code_convert_string_norecord
  7722                (msg, Vlocale_coding_system, 1));
  7723 
  7724       opoint = PT;
  7725       opoint_byte = PT_BYTE;
  7726       /* Insert new output into buffer
  7727          at the current end-of-output marker,
  7728          thus preserving logical ordering of input and output.  */
  7729       if (XMARKER (p->mark)->buffer)
  7730         Fgoto_char (p->mark);
  7731       else
  7732         SET_PT_BOTH (ZV, ZV_BYTE);
  7733 
  7734       before = PT;
  7735       before_byte = PT_BYTE;
  7736 
  7737       tem = BVAR (current_buffer, read_only);
  7738       bset_read_only (current_buffer, Qnil);
  7739       insert_string ("\nProcess ");
  7740       { /* FIXME: temporary kludge.  */
  7741         Lisp_Object tem2 = p->name; Finsert (1, &tem2); }
  7742       insert_string (" ");
  7743       Finsert (1, &msg);
  7744       bset_read_only (current_buffer, tem);
  7745       set_marker_both (p->mark, p->buffer, PT, PT_BYTE);
  7746 
  7747       if (opoint >= before)
  7748         SET_PT_BOTH (opoint + (PT - before),
  7749                      opoint_byte + (PT_BYTE - before_byte));
  7750       else
  7751         SET_PT_BOTH (opoint, opoint_byte);
  7752 
  7753       set_buffer_internal (old);
  7754     }
  7755   return Qnil;
  7756 }
  7757 
  7758 
  7759 DEFUN ("set-process-coding-system", Fset_process_coding_system,
  7760        Sset_process_coding_system, 1, 3, 0,
  7761        doc: /* Set coding systems of PROCESS to DECODING and ENCODING.
  7762 DECODING will be used to decode subprocess output and ENCODING to
  7763 encode subprocess input. */)
  7764   (Lisp_Object process, Lisp_Object decoding, Lisp_Object encoding)
  7765 {
  7766   CHECK_PROCESS (process);
  7767 
  7768   struct Lisp_Process *p = XPROCESS (process);
  7769 
  7770   Fcheck_coding_system (decoding);
  7771   Fcheck_coding_system (encoding);
  7772   encoding = coding_inherit_eol_type (encoding, Qnil);
  7773   pset_decode_coding_system (p, decoding);
  7774   pset_encode_coding_system (p, encoding);
  7775 
  7776   /* If the sockets haven't been set up yet, the final setup part of
  7777      this will be called asynchronously. */
  7778   if (p->infd < 0 || p->outfd < 0)
  7779     return Qnil;
  7780 
  7781   setup_process_coding_systems (process);
  7782 
  7783   return Qnil;
  7784 }
  7785 
  7786 DEFUN ("process-coding-system",
  7787        Fprocess_coding_system, Sprocess_coding_system, 1, 1, 0,
  7788        doc: /* Return a cons of coding systems for decoding and encoding of PROCESS.  */)
  7789   (register Lisp_Object process)
  7790 {
  7791   CHECK_PROCESS (process);
  7792   return Fcons (XPROCESS (process)->decode_coding_system,
  7793                 XPROCESS (process)->encode_coding_system);
  7794 }
  7795 
  7796 
  7797 
  7798 
  7799 # ifdef HAVE_GPM
  7800 
  7801 void
  7802 add_gpm_wait_descriptor (int desc)
  7803 {
  7804   add_keyboard_wait_descriptor (desc);
  7805 }
  7806 
  7807 void
  7808 delete_gpm_wait_descriptor (int desc)
  7809 {
  7810   delete_keyboard_wait_descriptor (desc);
  7811 }
  7812 
  7813 # endif
  7814 
  7815 #if defined (USABLE_SIGIO) || defined (USABLE_SIGPOLL)
  7816 
  7817 /* Return true if *MASK has a bit set
  7818    that corresponds to one of the keyboard input descriptors.  */
  7819 
  7820 static bool
  7821 keyboard_bit_set (fd_set *mask)
  7822 {
  7823   int fd;
  7824 
  7825   eassert (max_desc < FD_SETSIZE);
  7826   for (fd = 0; fd <= max_desc; fd++)
  7827     if (FD_ISSET (fd, mask)
  7828         && ((fd_callback_info[fd].flags & (FOR_READ | KEYBOARD_FD))
  7829             == (FOR_READ | KEYBOARD_FD)))
  7830       return 1;
  7831 
  7832   return 0;
  7833 }
  7834 # endif
  7835 
  7836 #else  /* not subprocesses */
  7837 
  7838 /* This is referenced in thread.c:run_thread (which is never actually
  7839    called, since threads are not enabled for this configuration.  */
  7840 void
  7841 update_processes_for_thread_death (Lisp_Object dying_thread)
  7842 {
  7843 }
  7844 
  7845 /* Defined in msdos.c.  */
  7846 extern int sys_select (int, fd_set *, fd_set *, fd_set *,
  7847                        struct timespec *, void *);
  7848 
  7849 /* Implementation of wait_reading_process_output, assuming that there
  7850    are no subprocesses.  Used only by the MS-DOS build.
  7851 
  7852    Wait for timeout to elapse and/or keyboard input to be available.
  7853 
  7854    TIME_LIMIT is:
  7855      timeout in seconds
  7856      If negative, gobble data immediately available but don't wait for any.
  7857 
  7858    NSECS is:
  7859      an additional duration to wait, measured in nanoseconds
  7860      If TIME_LIMIT is zero, then:
  7861        If NSECS == 0, there is no limit.
  7862        If NSECS > 0, the timeout consists of NSECS only.
  7863        If NSECS < 0, gobble data immediately, as if TIME_LIMIT were negative.
  7864 
  7865    READ_KBD is:
  7866      0 to ignore keyboard input, or
  7867      1 to return when input is available, or
  7868      -1 means caller will actually read the input, so don't throw to
  7869        the quit handler.
  7870 
  7871    see full version for other parameters. We know that wait_proc will
  7872      always be NULL, since `subprocesses' isn't defined.
  7873 
  7874    DO_DISPLAY means redisplay should be done to show subprocess
  7875    output that arrives.
  7876 
  7877    Return -1 signifying we got no output and did not try.  */
  7878 
  7879 int
  7880 wait_reading_process_output (intmax_t time_limit, int nsecs, int read_kbd,
  7881                              bool do_display,
  7882                              Lisp_Object wait_for_cell,
  7883                              struct Lisp_Process *wait_proc, int just_wait_proc)
  7884 {
  7885   register int nfds;
  7886   struct timespec end_time, timeout;
  7887   enum { MINIMUM = -1, TIMEOUT, FOREVER } wait;
  7888 
  7889   if (TYPE_MAXIMUM (time_t) < time_limit)
  7890     time_limit = TYPE_MAXIMUM (time_t);
  7891 
  7892   if (time_limit < 0 || nsecs < 0)
  7893     wait = MINIMUM;
  7894   else if (time_limit > 0 || nsecs > 0)
  7895     {
  7896       wait = TIMEOUT;
  7897       end_time = timespec_add (current_timespec (),
  7898                                make_timespec (time_limit, nsecs));
  7899     }
  7900   else
  7901     wait = FOREVER;
  7902 
  7903   /* Turn off periodic alarms (in case they are in use)
  7904      and then turn off any other atimers,
  7905      because the select emulator uses alarms.  */
  7906   stop_polling ();
  7907   turn_on_atimers (0);
  7908 
  7909   while (1)
  7910     {
  7911       bool timeout_reduced_for_timers = false;
  7912       fd_set waitchannels;
  7913       int xerrno;
  7914 
  7915       /* If calling from keyboard input, do not quit
  7916          since we want to return C-g as an input character.
  7917          Otherwise, do pending quit if requested.  */
  7918       if (read_kbd >= 0)
  7919         maybe_quit ();
  7920 
  7921       /* Exit now if the cell we're waiting for became non-nil.  */
  7922       if (! NILP (wait_for_cell) && ! NILP (XCAR (wait_for_cell)))
  7923         break;
  7924 
  7925       /* Compute time from now till when time limit is up.  */
  7926       /* Exit if already run out.  */
  7927       if (wait == TIMEOUT)
  7928         {
  7929           struct timespec now = current_timespec ();
  7930           if (timespec_cmp (end_time, now) <= 0)
  7931             break;
  7932           timeout = timespec_sub (end_time, now);
  7933         }
  7934       else
  7935         timeout = make_timespec (wait < TIMEOUT ? 0 : 100000, 0);
  7936 
  7937       /* If our caller will not immediately handle keyboard events,
  7938          run timer events directly.
  7939          (Callers that will immediately read keyboard events
  7940          call timer_delay on their own.)  */
  7941       if (NILP (wait_for_cell))
  7942         {
  7943           struct timespec timer_delay;
  7944 
  7945           do
  7946             {
  7947               unsigned old_timers_run = timers_run;
  7948               timer_delay = timer_check ();
  7949               if (timers_run != old_timers_run && do_display)
  7950                 /* We must retry, since a timer may have requeued itself
  7951                    and that could alter the time delay.  */
  7952                 redisplay_preserve_echo_area (14);
  7953               else
  7954                 break;
  7955             }
  7956           while (!detect_input_pending ());
  7957 
  7958           /* If there is unread keyboard input, also return.  */
  7959           if (read_kbd != 0
  7960               && requeued_events_pending_p ())
  7961             break;
  7962 
  7963           if (timespec_valid_p (timer_delay))
  7964             {
  7965               if (timespec_cmp (timer_delay, timeout) < 0)
  7966                 {
  7967                   timeout = timer_delay;
  7968                   timeout_reduced_for_timers = true;
  7969                 }
  7970             }
  7971         }
  7972 
  7973       /* Cause C-g and alarm signals to take immediate action,
  7974          and cause input available signals to zero out timeout.  */
  7975       if (read_kbd < 0)
  7976         set_waiting_for_input (&timeout);
  7977 
  7978       /* If a frame has been newly mapped and needs updating,
  7979          reprocess its display stuff.  */
  7980       if (frame_garbaged && do_display)
  7981         {
  7982           clear_waiting_for_input ();
  7983           redisplay_preserve_echo_area (15);
  7984           if (read_kbd < 0)
  7985             set_waiting_for_input (&timeout);
  7986         }
  7987 
  7988       /* Wait till there is something to do.  */
  7989       FD_ZERO (&waitchannels);
  7990       if (read_kbd && detect_input_pending ())
  7991         nfds = 0;
  7992       else
  7993         {
  7994           if (read_kbd || !NILP (wait_for_cell))
  7995             FD_SET (0, &waitchannels);
  7996           nfds = pselect (1, &waitchannels, NULL, NULL, &timeout, NULL);
  7997         }
  7998 
  7999       xerrno = errno;
  8000 
  8001       /* Make C-g and alarm signals set flags again.  */
  8002       clear_waiting_for_input ();
  8003 
  8004       /*  If we woke up due to SIGWINCH, actually change size now.  */
  8005       do_pending_window_change (0);
  8006 
  8007       if (wait < FOREVER && nfds == 0 && ! timeout_reduced_for_timers)
  8008         /* We waited the full specified time, so return now.  */
  8009         break;
  8010 
  8011       if (nfds == -1)
  8012         {
  8013           /* If the system call was interrupted, then go around the
  8014              loop again.  */
  8015           if (xerrno == EINTR)
  8016             FD_ZERO (&waitchannels);
  8017           else
  8018             report_file_errno ("Failed select", Qnil, xerrno);
  8019         }
  8020 
  8021       /* Check for keyboard input.  */
  8022 
  8023       if (read_kbd
  8024           && detect_input_pending_run_timers (do_display))
  8025         {
  8026           swallow_events (do_display);
  8027           if (detect_input_pending_run_timers (do_display))
  8028             break;
  8029         }
  8030 
  8031       /* If there is unread keyboard input, also return.  */
  8032       if (read_kbd
  8033           && requeued_events_pending_p ())
  8034         break;
  8035 
  8036       /* If wait_for_cell. check for keyboard input
  8037          but don't run any timers.
  8038          ??? (It seems wrong to me to check for keyboard
  8039          input at all when wait_for_cell, but the code
  8040          has been this way since July 1994.
  8041          Try changing this after version 19.31.)  */
  8042       if (! NILP (wait_for_cell)
  8043           && detect_input_pending ())
  8044         {
  8045           swallow_events (do_display);
  8046           if (detect_input_pending ())
  8047             break;
  8048         }
  8049 
  8050       /* Exit now if the cell we're waiting for became non-nil.  */
  8051       if (! NILP (wait_for_cell) && ! NILP (XCAR (wait_for_cell)))
  8052         break;
  8053     }
  8054 
  8055   start_polling ();
  8056 
  8057   return -1;
  8058 }
  8059 
  8060 #endif  /* not subprocesses */
  8061 
  8062 /* The following functions are needed even if async subprocesses are
  8063    not supported.  Some of them are no-op stubs in that case.  */
  8064 
  8065 #ifdef HAVE_TIMERFD
  8066 
  8067 /* Add FD, which is a descriptor returned by timerfd_create,
  8068    to the set of non-keyboard input descriptors.  */
  8069 
  8070 void
  8071 add_timer_wait_descriptor (int fd)
  8072 {
  8073   eassert (0 <= fd && fd < FD_SETSIZE);
  8074   add_read_fd (fd, timerfd_callback, NULL);
  8075   fd_callback_info[fd].flags &= ~KEYBOARD_FD;
  8076 }
  8077 
  8078 #endif /* HAVE_TIMERFD */
  8079 
  8080 /* If program file NAME starts with /: for quoting a magic
  8081    name, remove that, preserving the multibyteness of NAME.  */
  8082 
  8083 Lisp_Object
  8084 remove_slash_colon (Lisp_Object name)
  8085 {
  8086   return
  8087     (SREF (name, 0) == '/' && SREF (name, 1) == ':'
  8088      ? make_specified_string (SSDATA (name) + 2, SCHARS (name) - 2,
  8089                               SBYTES (name) - 2, STRING_MULTIBYTE (name))
  8090      : name);
  8091 }
  8092 
  8093 /* Add DESC to the set of keyboard input descriptors.  */
  8094 
  8095 void
  8096 add_keyboard_wait_descriptor (int desc)
  8097 {
  8098 #ifdef subprocesses /* Actually means "not MSDOS".  */
  8099   eassert (desc >= 0 && desc < FD_SETSIZE);
  8100   fd_callback_info[desc].flags &= ~PROCESS_FD;
  8101   fd_callback_info[desc].flags |= (FOR_READ | KEYBOARD_FD);
  8102   if (desc > max_desc)
  8103     max_desc = desc;
  8104 #endif
  8105 }
  8106 
  8107 /* From now on, do not expect DESC to give keyboard input.  */
  8108 
  8109 void
  8110 delete_keyboard_wait_descriptor (int desc)
  8111 {
  8112 #ifdef subprocesses
  8113   eassert (desc >= 0 && desc < FD_SETSIZE);
  8114 
  8115   fd_callback_info[desc].flags &= ~(FOR_READ | KEYBOARD_FD | PROCESS_FD);
  8116 
  8117   if (desc == max_desc)
  8118     recompute_max_desc ();
  8119 #endif
  8120 }
  8121 
  8122 /* Setup coding systems of PROCESS.  */
  8123 
  8124 void
  8125 setup_process_coding_systems (Lisp_Object process)
  8126 {
  8127 #ifdef subprocesses
  8128   struct Lisp_Process *p = XPROCESS (process);
  8129   int inch = p->infd;
  8130   int outch = p->outfd;
  8131   Lisp_Object coding_system;
  8132 
  8133   if (inch < 0 || outch < 0)
  8134     return;
  8135 
  8136   eassert (0 <= inch && inch < FD_SETSIZE);
  8137   if (!proc_decode_coding_system[inch])
  8138     proc_decode_coding_system[inch] = xmalloc (sizeof (struct coding_system));
  8139   coding_system = p->decode_coding_system;
  8140   if (EQ (p->filter, Qinternal_default_process_filter)
  8141       && BUFFERP (p->buffer))
  8142     {
  8143       if (NILP (BVAR (XBUFFER (p->buffer), enable_multibyte_characters)))
  8144         coding_system = raw_text_coding_system (coding_system);
  8145     }
  8146   setup_coding_system (coding_system, proc_decode_coding_system[inch]);
  8147 
  8148   eassert (0 <= outch && outch < FD_SETSIZE);
  8149   if (!proc_encode_coding_system[outch])
  8150     proc_encode_coding_system[outch] = xmalloc (sizeof (struct coding_system));
  8151   setup_coding_system (p->encode_coding_system,
  8152                        proc_encode_coding_system[outch]);
  8153 #endif
  8154 }
  8155 
  8156 DEFUN ("get-buffer-process", Fget_buffer_process, Sget_buffer_process, 1, 1, 0,
  8157        doc: /* Return the (or a) live process associated with BUFFER.
  8158 BUFFER may be a buffer or the name of one.
  8159 Return nil if all processes associated with BUFFER have been
  8160 deleted or killed.  */)
  8161   (register Lisp_Object buffer)
  8162 {
  8163 #ifdef subprocesses
  8164   register Lisp_Object buf, tail, proc;
  8165 
  8166   if (NILP (buffer)) return Qnil;
  8167   buf = Fget_buffer (buffer);
  8168   if (NILP (buf)) return Qnil;
  8169 
  8170   FOR_EACH_PROCESS (tail, proc)
  8171     if (EQ (XPROCESS (proc)->buffer, buf))
  8172       return proc;
  8173 #endif  /* subprocesses */
  8174   return Qnil;
  8175 }
  8176 
  8177 DEFUN ("process-inherit-coding-system-flag",
  8178        Fprocess_inherit_coding_system_flag, Sprocess_inherit_coding_system_flag,
  8179        1, 1, 0,
  8180        doc: /* Return the value of inherit-coding-system flag for PROCESS.
  8181 If this flag is t, `buffer-file-coding-system' of the buffer
  8182 associated with PROCESS will inherit the coding system used to decode
  8183 the process output.  */)
  8184   (register Lisp_Object process)
  8185 {
  8186 #ifdef subprocesses
  8187   CHECK_PROCESS (process);
  8188   return XPROCESS (process)->inherit_coding_system_flag ? Qt : Qnil;
  8189 #else
  8190   /* Ignore the argument and return the value of
  8191      inherit-process-coding-system.  */
  8192   return inherit_process_coding_system ? Qt : Qnil;
  8193 #endif
  8194 }
  8195 
  8196 /* Kill all processes associated with `buffer'.
  8197    If `buffer' is nil, kill all processes.  */
  8198 
  8199 void
  8200 kill_buffer_processes (Lisp_Object buffer)
  8201 {
  8202 #ifdef subprocesses
  8203   Lisp_Object tail, proc;
  8204 
  8205   FOR_EACH_PROCESS (tail, proc)
  8206     if (NILP (buffer) || EQ (XPROCESS (proc)->buffer, buffer))
  8207       {
  8208         if (NETCONN_P (proc) || SERIALCONN_P (proc) || PIPECONN_P (proc))
  8209           Fdelete_process (proc);
  8210         else if (XPROCESS (proc)->infd >= 0)
  8211           process_send_signal (proc, SIGHUP, Qnil, 1);
  8212       }
  8213 #else  /* subprocesses */
  8214   /* Since we have no subprocesses, this does nothing.  */
  8215 #endif /* subprocesses */
  8216 }
  8217 
  8218 DEFUN ("waiting-for-user-input-p", Fwaiting_for_user_input_p,
  8219        Swaiting_for_user_input_p, 0, 0, 0,
  8220        doc: /* Return non-nil if Emacs is waiting for input from the user.
  8221 This is intended for use by asynchronous process output filters and sentinels.  */)
  8222   (void)
  8223 {
  8224 #ifdef subprocesses
  8225   return (waiting_for_user_input_p ? Qt : Qnil);
  8226 #else
  8227   return Qnil;
  8228 #endif
  8229 }
  8230 
  8231 /* Stop reading input from keyboard sources.  */
  8232 
  8233 void
  8234 hold_keyboard_input (void)
  8235 {
  8236   kbd_is_on_hold = 1;
  8237 }
  8238 
  8239 /* Resume reading input from keyboard sources.  */
  8240 
  8241 void
  8242 unhold_keyboard_input (void)
  8243 {
  8244   kbd_is_on_hold = 0;
  8245 }
  8246 
  8247 /* Return true if keyboard input is on hold, zero otherwise.  */
  8248 
  8249 bool
  8250 kbd_on_hold_p (void)
  8251 {
  8252   return kbd_is_on_hold;
  8253 }
  8254 
  8255 
  8256 /* Enumeration of and access to system processes a-la ps(1).  */
  8257 
  8258 DEFUN ("list-system-processes", Flist_system_processes, Slist_system_processes,
  8259        0, 0, 0,
  8260        doc: /* Return a list of numerical process IDs of all running processes.
  8261 If this functionality is unsupported, return nil.
  8262 If `default-directory' is remote, return process IDs of the respective remote host.
  8263 
  8264 See `process-attributes' for getting attributes of a process given its ID.  */)
  8265   (void)
  8266 {
  8267   Lisp_Object handler
  8268     = Ffind_file_name_handler (BVAR (current_buffer, directory),
  8269                                Qlist_system_processes);
  8270   if (!NILP (handler))
  8271     return call1 (handler, Qlist_system_processes);
  8272 
  8273   return list_system_processes ();
  8274 }
  8275 
  8276 DEFUN ("process-attributes", Fprocess_attributes,
  8277        Sprocess_attributes, 1, 1, 0,
  8278        doc: /* Return attributes of the process given by its PID, a number.
  8279 If `default-directory' is remote, PID is regarded as process
  8280 identifier on the respective remote host.
  8281 
  8282 Value is an alist where each element is a cons cell of the form
  8283 
  8284     (KEY . VALUE)
  8285 
  8286 If this functionality is unsupported, the value is nil.
  8287 
  8288 See `list-system-processes' for getting a list of all process IDs.
  8289 
  8290 The KEYs of the attributes that this function may return are listed
  8291 below, together with the type of the associated VALUE (in parentheses).
  8292 Not all platforms support all of these attributes; unsupported
  8293 attributes will not appear in the returned alist.
  8294 Unless explicitly indicated otherwise, numbers can have either
  8295 integer or floating point values.
  8296 
  8297  euid    -- Effective user User ID of the process (number)
  8298  user    -- User name corresponding to euid (string)
  8299  egid    -- Effective user Group ID of the process (number)
  8300  group   -- Group name corresponding to egid (string)
  8301  comm    -- Command name (executable name only) (string)
  8302  state   -- Process state code, such as "S", "R", or "T" (string)
  8303  ppid    -- Parent process ID (number)
  8304  pgrp    -- Process group ID (number)
  8305  sess    -- Session ID, i.e. process ID of session leader (number)
  8306  ttname  -- Controlling tty name (string)
  8307  tpgid   -- ID of foreground process group on the process's tty (number)
  8308  minflt  -- number of minor page faults (number)
  8309  majflt  -- number of major page faults (number)
  8310  cminflt -- cumulative number of minor page faults (number)
  8311  cmajflt -- cumulative number of major page faults (number)
  8312  utime   -- user time used by the process, in `current-time' format
  8313  stime   -- system time used by the process (current-time)
  8314  time    -- sum of utime and stime (current-time)
  8315  cutime  -- user time used by the process and its children (current-time)
  8316  cstime  -- system time used by the process and its children (current-time)
  8317  ctime   -- sum of cutime and cstime (current-time)
  8318  pri     -- priority of the process (number)
  8319  nice    -- nice value of the process (number)
  8320  thcount -- process thread count (number)
  8321  start   -- time the process started (current-time)
  8322  vsize   -- virtual memory size of the process in KB's (number)
  8323  rss     -- resident set size of the process in KB's (number)
