  8324  etime   -- elapsed time the process is running (current-time)
  8325  pcpu    -- percents of CPU time used by the process (floating-point number)
  8326  pmem    -- percents of total physical memory used by process's resident set
  8327               (floating-point number)
  8328  args    -- command line which invoked the process (string).  */)
  8329   ( Lisp_Object pid)
  8330 {
  8331   Lisp_Object handler
  8332     = Ffind_file_name_handler (BVAR (current_buffer, directory),
  8333                                Qprocess_attributes);
  8334   if (!NILP (handler))
  8335     return call2 (handler, Qprocess_attributes, pid);
  8336 
  8337   return system_process_attributes (pid);
  8338 }
  8339 
  8340 DEFUN ("num-processors", Fnum_processors, Snum_processors, 0, 1, 0,
  8341        doc: /* Return the number of processors, a positive integer.
  8342 Each usable thread execution unit counts as a processor.
  8343 By default, count the number of available processors,
  8344 overridable via the OMP_NUM_THREADS environment variable.
  8345 If optional argument QUERY is `current', ignore OMP_NUM_THREADS.
  8346 If QUERY is `all', also count processors not available.  */)
  8347   (Lisp_Object query)
  8348 {
  8349 #ifndef MSDOS
  8350   return make_uint (num_processors (EQ (query, Qall) ? NPROC_ALL
  8351                                     : EQ (query, Qcurrent) ? NPROC_CURRENT
  8352                                     : NPROC_CURRENT_OVERRIDABLE));
  8353 #else
  8354   return make_fixnum (1);
  8355 #endif
  8356 }
  8357 
  8358 DEFUN ("signal-names", Fsignal_names, Ssignal_names, 0, 0, 0,
  8359        doc: /* Return a list of known signal names on this system.  */)
  8360   (void)
  8361 {
  8362 #ifndef MSDOS
  8363   int i;
  8364   char name[SIG2STR_MAX];
  8365   Lisp_Object names = Qnil;
  8366 
  8367   for (i = 0; i <= SIGNUM_BOUND; ++i)
  8368     {
  8369       if (!sig2str (i, name))
  8370         names = Fcons (build_string (name), names);
  8371     }
  8372 
  8373   return names;
  8374 #else
  8375   return Qnil;
  8376 #endif
  8377 }
  8378 
  8379 #ifdef subprocesses
  8380 /* Arrange to catch SIGCHLD if this hasn't already been arranged.
  8381    Invoke this after init_process_emacs, and after Glib and/or GNUstep
  8382    futz with the SIGCHLD handler, but before Emacs forks any children.
  8383    This function's caller should block SIGCHLD.  */
  8384 
  8385 void
  8386 catch_child_signal (void)
  8387 {
  8388   struct sigaction action, old_action;
  8389   sigset_t oldset;
  8390   emacs_sigaction_init (&action, deliver_child_signal);
  8391   block_child_signal (&oldset);
  8392   sigaction (SIGCHLD, &action, &old_action);
  8393   eassert (old_action.sa_handler == SIG_DFL || old_action.sa_handler == SIG_IGN
  8394            || ! (old_action.sa_flags & SA_SIGINFO));
  8395 
  8396   if (old_action.sa_handler != deliver_child_signal)
  8397     lib_child_handler
  8398       = (old_action.sa_handler == SIG_DFL || old_action.sa_handler == SIG_IGN
  8399          ? dummy_handler
  8400          : old_action.sa_handler);
  8401   unblock_child_signal (&oldset);
  8402 }
  8403 #endif  /* subprocesses */
  8404 
  8405 /* Limit the number of open files to the value it had at startup.  */
  8406 
  8407 void
  8408 restore_nofile_limit (void)
  8409 {
  8410 #ifdef HAVE_SETRLIMIT
  8411   if (FD_SETSIZE < nofile_limit.rlim_cur)
  8412     setrlimit (RLIMIT_NOFILE, &nofile_limit);
  8413 #endif
  8414 }
  8415 
  8416 int
  8417 open_channel_for_module (Lisp_Object process)
  8418 {
  8419   CHECK_PROCESS (process);
  8420   CHECK_TYPE (PIPECONN_P (process), Qpipe_process_p, process);
  8421 #ifndef MSDOS
  8422   int fd = dup (XPROCESS (process)->open_fd[SUBPROCESS_STDOUT]);
  8423   if (fd == -1)
  8424     report_file_error ("Cannot duplicate file descriptor", Qnil);
  8425   return fd;
  8426 #else
  8427   /* PIPECONN_P returning true shouldn't be possible on MSDOS.  */
  8428   emacs_abort ();
  8429 #endif
  8430 }
  8431 
  8432 
  8433 /* This is not called "init_process" because that is the name of a
  8434    Mach system call, so it would cause problems on Darwin systems.  */
  8435 void
  8436 init_process_emacs (int sockfd)
  8437 {
  8438 #ifdef subprocesses
  8439   int i;
  8440 
  8441   inhibit_sentinels = 0;
  8442 
  8443   if (!will_dump_with_unexec_p ())
  8444     {
  8445 #if defined HAVE_GLIB && !defined WINDOWSNT
  8446       /* Tickle Glib's child-handling code.  Ask Glib to install a
  8447          watch source for Emacs itself which will initialize glib's
  8448          private SIGCHLD handler, allowing catch_child_signal to copy
  8449          it into lib_child_handler.  This is a hacky workaround to get
  8450          glib's g_unix_signal_handler into lib_child_handler.
  8451 
  8452          In Glib 2.37.5 (2013), commit 2e471acf changed Glib to
  8453          always install a signal handler when g_child_watch_source_new
  8454          is called and not just the first time it's called, and to
  8455          reset signal handlers to SIG_DFL when it no longer has a
  8456          watcher on that signal.  Arrange for Emacs's signal handler
  8457          to be reinstalled even if this happens.
  8458 
  8459          In Glib 2.73.2 (2022), commit f615eef4 changed Glib again,
  8460          to not install a signal handler if the system supports
  8461          pidfd_open and waitid (as in Linux kernel 5.3+).  The hacky
  8462          workaround is not needed in this case.  */
  8463       GSource *source = g_child_watch_source_new (getpid ());
  8464       catch_child_signal ();
  8465       g_source_unref (source);
  8466 
  8467       if (lib_child_handler != dummy_handler)
  8468         {
  8469           /* The hacky workaround is needed on this platform.  */
  8470           signal_handler_t lib_child_handler_glib = lib_child_handler;
  8471           catch_child_signal ();
  8472           eassert (lib_child_handler == dummy_handler);
  8473           lib_child_handler = lib_child_handler_glib;
  8474         }
  8475 #else
  8476       catch_child_signal ();
  8477 #endif
  8478     }
  8479 
  8480 #ifdef HAVE_SETRLIMIT
  8481   /* Don't allocate more than FD_SETSIZE file descriptors for Emacs itself.  */
  8482   if (getrlimit (RLIMIT_NOFILE, &nofile_limit) != 0)
  8483     nofile_limit.rlim_cur = 0;
  8484   else if (FD_SETSIZE < nofile_limit.rlim_cur)
  8485     {
  8486       struct rlimit rlim = nofile_limit;
  8487       rlim.rlim_cur = FD_SETSIZE;
  8488       if (setrlimit (RLIMIT_NOFILE, &rlim) != 0)
  8489         nofile_limit.rlim_cur = 0;
  8490     }
  8491 #endif
  8492 
  8493   external_sock_fd = sockfd;
  8494   Lisp_Object sockname = Qnil;
  8495 # if HAVE_GETSOCKNAME
  8496   if (0 <= sockfd)
  8497     {
  8498       union u_sockaddr sa;
  8499       socklen_t salen = sizeof sa;
  8500       if (getsockname (sockfd, &sa.sa, &salen) == 0)
  8501         sockname = conv_sockaddr_to_lisp (&sa.sa, salen);
  8502     }
  8503 # endif
  8504   Vinternal__daemon_sockname = sockname;
  8505 
  8506   max_desc = -1;
  8507   memset (fd_callback_info, 0, sizeof (fd_callback_info));
  8508 
  8509   num_pending_connects = 0;
  8510 
  8511   process_output_delay_count = 0;
  8512   process_output_skip = 0;
  8513 
  8514   /* Don't do this, it caused infinite select loops.  The display
  8515      method should call add_keyboard_wait_descriptor on stdin if it
  8516      needs that.  */
  8517 #if 0
  8518   FD_SET (0, &input_wait_mask);
  8519 #endif
  8520 
  8521   Vprocess_alist = Qnil;
  8522   deleted_pid_list = Qnil;
  8523   for (i = 0; i < FD_SETSIZE; i++)
  8524     {
  8525       chan_process[i] = Qnil;
  8526       proc_buffered_char[i] = -1;
  8527     }
  8528   memset (proc_decode_coding_system, 0, sizeof proc_decode_coding_system);
  8529   memset (proc_encode_coding_system, 0, sizeof proc_encode_coding_system);
  8530 #ifdef DATAGRAM_SOCKETS
  8531   memset (datagram_address, 0, sizeof datagram_address);
  8532 #endif
  8533 
  8534 #endif  /* subprocesses */
  8535   kbd_is_on_hold = 0;
  8536 }
  8537 
  8538 void
  8539 syms_of_process (void)
  8540 {
  8541   DEFSYM (Qmake_process, "make-process");
  8542   DEFSYM (Qlist_system_processes, "list-system-processes");
  8543   DEFSYM (Qprocess_attributes, "process-attributes");
  8544 
  8545 #ifdef subprocesses
  8546 
  8547   DEFSYM (Qprocessp, "processp");
  8548   DEFSYM (Qrun, "run");
  8549   DEFSYM (Qstop, "stop");
  8550   DEFSYM (Qsignal, "signal");
  8551 
  8552   /* Qexit is already staticpro'd by syms_of_eval; don't staticpro it
  8553      here again.  */
  8554 
  8555   DEFSYM (Qopen, "open");
  8556   DEFSYM (Qclosed, "closed");
  8557   DEFSYM (Qconnect, "connect");
  8558   DEFSYM (Qfailed, "failed");
  8559   DEFSYM (Qlisten, "listen");
  8560   DEFSYM (Qlocal, "local");
  8561   DEFSYM (Qipv4, "ipv4");
  8562 #ifdef AF_INET6
  8563   DEFSYM (Qipv6, "ipv6");
  8564 #endif
  8565   DEFSYM (Qnumeric, "numeric");
  8566   DEFSYM (Qdatagram, "datagram");
  8567   DEFSYM (Qseqpacket, "seqpacket");
  8568 
  8569   DEFSYM (QCport, ":port");
  8570   DEFSYM (QCspeed, ":speed");
  8571   DEFSYM (QCprocess, ":process");
  8572 
  8573   DEFSYM (QCbytesize, ":bytesize");
  8574   DEFSYM (QCstopbits, ":stopbits");
  8575   DEFSYM (QCparity, ":parity");
  8576   DEFSYM (Qodd, "odd");
  8577   DEFSYM (Qeven, "even");
  8578   DEFSYM (QCflowcontrol, ":flowcontrol");
  8579   DEFSYM (Qhw, "hw");
  8580   DEFSYM (Qsw, "sw");
  8581   DEFSYM (QCsummary, ":summary");
  8582 
  8583   DEFSYM (Qreal, "real");
  8584   DEFSYM (Qnetwork, "network");
  8585   DEFSYM (Qserial, "serial");
  8586   DEFSYM (QCfile_handler, ":file-handler");
  8587   DEFSYM (QCbuffer, ":buffer");
  8588   DEFSYM (QChost, ":host");
  8589   DEFSYM (QCservice, ":service");
  8590   DEFSYM (QClocal, ":local");
  8591   DEFSYM (QCremote, ":remote");
  8592   DEFSYM (QCcoding, ":coding");
  8593   DEFSYM (QCserver, ":server");
  8594   DEFSYM (QCnowait, ":nowait");
  8595   DEFSYM (QCsentinel, ":sentinel");
  8596   DEFSYM (QCuse_external_socket, ":use-external-socket");
  8597   DEFSYM (QCtls_parameters, ":tls-parameters");
  8598   DEFSYM (Qnsm_verify_connection, "nsm-verify-connection");
  8599   DEFSYM (QClog, ":log");

  8614 #endif  /* subprocesses */

  8658 
  8659   DEFVAR_BOOL ("delete-exited-processes", delete_exited_processes,
  8660                doc: /* Non-nil means delete processes immediately when they exit.
  8661 A value of nil means don't delete them until `list-processes' is run.  */);
  8662 
  8663   delete_exited_processes = 1;
  8664 
  8665 #ifdef subprocesses
  8666   DEFVAR_LISP ("process-connection-type", Vprocess_connection_type,
  8667                doc: /* Control type of device used to communicate with subprocesses.
  8668 Values are nil to use a pipe, or t or `pty' to use a pty.
  8669 The value has no effect if the system has no ptys or if all ptys are busy:
  8670 then a pipe is used in any case.
  8671 The value takes effect when `start-process' is called.  */);
  8672   Vprocess_connection_type = Qt;
  8673 
  8674   DEFVAR_LISP ("process-adaptive-read-buffering", Vprocess_adaptive_read_buffering,
  8675                doc: /* If non-nil, improve receive buffering by delaying after short reads.
  8676 On some systems, when Emacs reads the output from a subprocess, the output data
  8677 is read in very small blocks, potentially resulting in very poor performance.
  8678 This behavior can be remedied to some extent by setting this variable to a
  8679 non-nil value, as it will automatically delay reading from such processes, to
  8680 allow them to produce more output before Emacs tries to read it.
  8681 If the value is t, the delay is reset after each write to the process; any other
  8682 non-nil value means that the delay is not reset on write.
  8683 The variable takes effect when `start-process' is called.  */);
  8684   Vprocess_adaptive_read_buffering = Qt;
  8685 
  8686   DEFVAR_BOOL ("process-prioritize-lower-fds", process_prioritize_lower_fds,
  8687                doc: /* Whether to start checking for subprocess output from first file descriptor.
  8688 Emacs loops through file descriptors to check for output from subprocesses.
  8689 If this variable is nil, the default, then after accepting output from a
  8690 subprocess, Emacs will continue checking the rest of descriptors, starting
  8691 from the one following the descriptor it just read.  If this variable is
  8692 non-nil, Emacs will always restart the loop from the first file descriptor,
  8693 thus favoring processes with lower descriptors.  */);
  8694   process_prioritize_lower_fds = 0;
  8695 
  8696   DEFVAR_LISP ("interrupt-process-functions", Vinterrupt_process_functions,
  8697                doc: /* List of functions to be called for `interrupt-process'.
  8698 The arguments of the functions are the same as for `interrupt-process'.
  8699 These functions are called in the order of the list, until one of them
  8700 returns non-nil.  */);
  8701   Vinterrupt_process_functions = list1 (Qinternal_default_interrupt_process);
  8702 
  8703   DEFVAR_LISP ("signal-process-functions", Vsignal_process_functions,
  8704                doc: /* List of functions to be called for `signal-process'.
  8705 The arguments of the functions are the same as for `signal-process'.
  8706 These functions are called in the order of the list, until one of them
  8707 returns non-nil.  */);
  8708   Vsignal_process_functions = list1 (Qinternal_default_signal_process);
  8709 
  8710   DEFVAR_LISP ("internal--daemon-sockname", Vinternal__daemon_sockname,
  8711                doc: /* Name of external socket passed to Emacs, or nil if none.  */);
  8712   Vinternal__daemon_sockname = Qnil;
  8713 
  8714   DEFVAR_INT ("read-process-output-max", read_process_output_max,
  8715               doc: /* Maximum number of bytes to read from subprocess in a single chunk.
  8716 Enlarge the value only if the subprocess generates very large (megabytes)
  8717 amounts of data in one go.
  8718 
  8719 On GNU/Linux systems, the value should not exceed
  8720 /proc/sys/fs/pipe-max-size.  See pipe(7) manpage for details.  */);
  8721   read_process_output_max = 4096;
  8722 
  8723   DEFVAR_INT ("process-error-pause-time", process_error_pause_time,
  8724               doc: /* The number of seconds to pause after handling process errors.
  8725 This isn't used for all process-related errors, but is used when a
  8726 sentinel or a process filter function has an error.  */);
  8727   process_error_pause_time = 1;
  8728 
  8729   DEFSYM (Qinternal_default_interrupt_process,
  8730           "internal-default-interrupt-process");
  8731   DEFSYM (Qinterrupt_process_functions, "interrupt-process-functions");
  8732 
  8733   DEFSYM (Qinternal_default_signal_process,
  8734           "internal-default-signal-process");
  8735   DEFSYM (Qsignal_process_functions, "signal-process-functions");
  8736 
  8737   DEFSYM (Qnull, "null");
  8738   DEFSYM (Qpipe_process_p, "pipe-process-p");
  8739   DEFSYM (Qmessage, "message");

  8774   defsubr (&Snetwork_lookup_address_info);
  8775   defsubr (&Snetwork_interface_list);
  8776   defsubr (&Snetwork_interface_info);
  8777 #ifdef DATAGRAM_SOCKETS
  8778   defsubr (&Sprocess_datagram_address);
  8779   defsubr (&Sset_process_datagram_address);
  8780 #endif
  8781   defsubr (&Saccept_process_output);
  8782   defsubr (&Sprocess_send_region);
  8783   defsubr (&Sprocess_send_string);
  8784   defsubr (&Sinternal_default_interrupt_process);
  8785   defsubr (&Sinterrupt_process);
  8786   defsubr (&Skill_process);
  8787   defsubr (&Squit_process);
  8788   defsubr (&Sstop_process);
  8789   defsubr (&Scontinue_process);
  8790   defsubr (&Sprocess_running_child_p);
  8791   defsubr (&Sprocess_send_eof);
  8792   defsubr (&Sinternal_default_signal_process);
  8793   defsubr (&Ssignal_process);
  8794   defsubr (&Swaiting_for_user_input_p);
  8795   defsubr (&Sprocess_type);
  8796   defsubr (&Sinternal_default_process_sentinel);
  8797   defsubr (&Sinternal_default_process_filter);
  8798   defsubr (&Sset_process_coding_system);
  8799   defsubr (&Sprocess_coding_system);
  8800 
  8801  {
  8802    Lisp_Object subfeatures = Qnil;
  8803    const struct socket_options *sopt;
  8804 
  8805 #define ADD_SUBFEATURE(key, val) \
  8806   subfeatures = pure_cons (pure_cons (key, pure_cons (val, Qnil)), subfeatures)
  8807 
  8808    ADD_SUBFEATURE (QCnowait, Qt);
  8809 #ifdef DATAGRAM_SOCKETS
  8810    ADD_SUBFEATURE (QCtype, Qdatagram);
  8811 #endif
  8812 #ifdef HAVE_SEQPACKET
  8813    ADD_SUBFEATURE (QCtype, Qseqpacket);
  8814 #endif
  8815 #ifdef HAVE_LOCAL_SOCKETS
  8816    ADD_SUBFEATURE (QCfamily, Qlocal);
  8817 #endif
  8818    ADD_SUBFEATURE (QCfamily, Qipv4);
  8819 #ifdef AF_INET6
  8820    ADD_SUBFEATURE (QCfamily, Qipv6);
  8821 #endif
  8822 #ifdef HAVE_GETSOCKNAME
  8823    ADD_SUBFEATURE (QCservice, Qt);
  8824 #endif
  8825    ADD_SUBFEATURE (QCserver, Qt);
  8826 
  8827    for (sopt = socket_options; sopt->name; sopt++)
  8828      subfeatures = pure_cons (intern_c_string (sopt->name), subfeatures);
  8829 
  8830    Fprovide (intern_c_string ("make-network-process"), subfeatures);
  8831  }
  8832 
  8833 #endif  /* subprocesses */
  8834 
  8835   defsubr (&Sget_buffer_process);
  8836   defsubr (&Sprocess_inherit_coding_system_flag);
  8837   defsubr (&Slist_system_processes);
  8838   defsubr (&Sprocess_attributes);
  8839   defsubr (&Snum_processors);
  8840   defsubr (&Ssignal_names);
  8841 }
/* [<][>][^][v][top][bottom][index][help] */
